about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: At a school crossing sign, you should:

about.name: At a school crossing sign, you should:

hasPart.assesses: At a school crossing sign, you should: | At a school crossing sign, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.

comment.text: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.

suggestedAnswer.text: Watch for children and be ready to stop.

comment.text: Watch for children and be ready to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always sound your horn when you see children.

comment.text: Always sound your horn when you see children.

acceptedAnswer.text: Watch for children and be ready to stop.

comment.text: Watch for children and be ready to stop.

answerExplanation.text: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

comment.text: At a school crossing sign, you should: | Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

hasPart.name: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is:

about.name: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is:

hasPart.assesses: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is: | Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal, if it is your child.

comment.text: Legal, if it is your child.
Illegal at all times.
Not restricted by law.
Illegal at all times.

answerExplanation.text: In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.

comment.text: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is: | In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.

hasPart.name: Yellow lines separate:
hasPart.assesses: Yellow lines separate: | Yellow lines separate: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

comment.text: Traffic lanes on one-way streets.

suggestedAnswer.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

comment.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

suggestedAnswer.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

comment.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

acceptedAnswer.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

comment.text: Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.

answerExplanation.text: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

comment.text: Yellow lines separate: | Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

hasPart.name: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?

about.name: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?

hasPart.assesses: When should you yield your legal right-of-way? | When should you yield your legal right-of-way? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

comment.text: Often, even at controlled intersections.
Whenever it helps prevent collisions.
Never. It confuses other drivers.
Whenever it helps prevent collisions.

answerExplanation.text: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

comment.text: When should you yield your legal right-of-way? | Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

hasPart.name: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper):

about.name: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper):

hasPart.assesses: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper): | Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper): -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

suggestedAnswer.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

comment.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

suggestedAnswer.text: Cannot result in a traffic citation.

comment.text: Cannot result in a traffic citation.

suggestedAnswer.text: Reduces collisions by preventing being "cut off."

comment.text: Reduces collisions by preventing being "cut off."

acceptedAnswer.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

comment.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

answerExplanation.text: Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

comment.text: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper): | Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

hasPart.name: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are:

about.name: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are:

hasPart.assesses: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are: | It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

suggestedAnswer.text: in need of the space and the bike lane is empty.

comment.text: in need of the space and the bike lane is empty.
Passing another vehicle

suggestedAnswer.text: Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

comment.text: Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

acceptedAnswer.text: Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

comment.text: Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

comment.text: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are: | It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).
